cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles ENE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, then turning west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast south of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mesquite Bay to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions; only a very small (3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds, with most likely gusts 20–30 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft possible in Galveston Bay as outer surge reaches north of Sargent to High Island.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain possible on the upper Texas coast, including Galveston.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents; isolated tornado threat cannot be ruled out.
